intro: Phagnalon graecum subsp. illyricum, commonly known as the Illyrian phagnalon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in composite inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
